content: 7 increase chain 2 keep loop with stitch marker 11 sts join with scrubby yarn row 27 with scrubby yarn- increase single_crochet 9 increase chain 3 remove hook keep loop with stitch marker 13 sts row 28 with cotton yarn- increase single_crochet 11 increase chain 1 turn 15 sts row 29 increase single_crochet 13 increase chain 2 keep loop with stitch marker 17 sts row 30 with scrubby yarn- increase single_crochet 15 increase chain 3 keep loop with stitch marker 19 sts row 31 with cotton yarn- single_crochet across chain 1 turn row 32 single_crochet across chain 2 turn keep loop with stitch marker row 33 with scrubby yarn- single_crochet across chain 1 turn row 34-48 repeat row 31-33 5 more times row 49 and finishing with cotton yarn- single_crochet 19 folding the mitt with bumps facing out single_crochet through the same stitch and corresponding original chain stitch in the matching corner on the bumpy side single_crochet 1 stitch per row through both sides increase in last joining row slip_stitch over 9 single_crochet row to get to the other side increase in first joining row single_crochet 1 stitch per row through both sides chain 10 slip_stitch to same stitch to make a hanging loop then single_crochet 38 into the single_crochet 19 from earlier in row 49 and the original chain fasten_off weave in ends this pattern is for personal use only do not distribute this pattern you may sell finished pieces with the disclaimer this item is handmade by your name with a pattern by hannah feuerborn razorback tack be sure to tag @razorback_tack and/or @feuerborn_fiber_arts on instagram or facebook with photos of the finished piece s
